required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of New Implantable Loop Recorder

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this IDE clinical study is to evaluate the quality of the cardiac signal recordings obtained by the St. Jude Medical (SJM) Confirm Implantable Cardiac Monitor (device).

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Exercise
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
primary_outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Stress Test
primary_outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
primary_outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.

other_outcome.measure: Interpretability of Weekly Subject Activator Recordings
other_outcome.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable was calculated for each weekly Patient Activator recording and for each subject. A random effects model was fitted to the data.

other_outcome.measure: Interpretability of Automatically Triggered/Symptom Driven Recordings
other_outcome.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable for each automatically triggered/symptom driven recording and for each subject.

other_outcome.measure: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings - Phase I
other_outcome.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a generalized estimating equation (GEE) model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.

other_outcome.measure: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings - Phase II
other_outcome.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a GEE model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.

intervention.description: All patients in this study will receive the SJM Confirm device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have clinical syndromes or situations at increased risk of cardiac arrhythmias
- Patients who experience transient symptoms that may suggest a cardiac arrhythmia
- Patients who have been previously diagnosed with atrial fibrillation
- Patients who are suspected to have Atrial Fibrillation (AF) but AF has not been documented
- Patients who have provided written informed consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are under the age of 18 years
- Patients who have a life expectancy less than 1 year
- Patients who are unable to comply with the follow-up schedule
- Patients who are currently implanted with a pacemaker or defibrillator
- Patients who the physician deems inappropriate for the study

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the St. Jude Medical (SJM Confirm device.

baseline.population: All patients implanted with the Confirm Device.

group.title: Open Label
group.description: All patients who were implanted with the SJM Confirm device.

outcome.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
outcome.description: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I were included in this analysis. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient with recording lacking the surface channel). Total analyzable recordings 88; 89-(1 recording lacking visible R waves).

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
measure.description: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I were included in this analysis. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient with recording lacking the surface channel). Total analyzable recordings 88; 89-(1 recording lacking visible R waves).

analysis.groups_desc: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording and for each subject as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recordings/Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded on surface ECG

outcome.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Exercise
outcome.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 46; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient's recording lacking surface ECG channel)-(2 no recording obtained). Total analyzable recordings =39; 46 obtained-(7 with zero visible R waves).

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Exercise
measure.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 46; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient's recording lacking surface ECG channel)-(2 no recording obtained). Total analyzable recordings =39; 46 obtained-(7 with zero visible R waves).

analysis.groups_desc: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording during the treadmill test and for each subject as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recordings/Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded on surface ECG

outcome.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
outcome.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel). Total analyzable recordings 82; 96 obtained-(14 recordings with zero visible R waves)=82 recordings

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Sensitivity for R Waves During In-Clinic Recordings During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
measure.description: The sensitivity for R waves during the in-clinic recordings was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel). Total analyzable recordings 82; 96 obtained-(14 recordings with zero visible R waves)=82 recordings

analysis.groups_desc: The sensitivity was calculated for each recording and for each subject during the hand to hand and hand to shoulder maneuvers as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recordings/Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded on surface ECG

outcome.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient with no recording obtained). Total analyzable recordings 89.

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings at Rest
measure.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient with no recording obtained). Total analyzable recordings 89.

analysis.groups_desc: The positive predictive value (PPV) was calculated for each recording and for each subject during the in-clinic recording at rest as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recording / Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded by device during in-clinic recording

outcome.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Stress Test
outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 45; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel)-(2 patients where no recording was obtained). Total analyzable recordings 45: 46 obtained-(1 recording with zero visible R waves).

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) for In-Clinic Recordings During Treadmill Stress Test
measure.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 45; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel)-(2 patients where no recording was obtained). Total analyzable recordings 45: 46 obtained-(1 recording with zero visible R waves).

analysis.groups_desc: The positive predictive value (PPV) was calculated for each recording and for each subject for the in-clinic recording during the treadmill exercise as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recording / Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded by device during in-clinic recording

outcome.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel). Total analyzable recordings 92: 96 obtained-(4 recordings with zero visible R waves)

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) During Hand to Hand/Shoulder Maneuvers
measure.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) for the in-clinic recording was was calculated for each recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 48; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(1 patient recording lacking surface ECG channel). Total analyzable recordings 92: 96 obtained-(4 recordings with zero visible R waves)

analysis.groups_desc: The positive predictive value (PPV) was calculated for each recording and for each subject during Hand to Hand and Hand to Shoulder Maneuvers as follows: Amount of time (sec) R waves recorded on surface ECG were detected on in-clinic recording / Total amount of time (sec) R waves were recorded by device during in-clinic recording

outcome.title: Interpretability of Weekly Subject Activator Recordings
outcome.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable was calculated for each weekly Patient Activator recording and for each subject. A random effects model was fitted to the data.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 30; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(19 patients who did not initiate recordings). Total analyzable recordings 58.

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Interpretability of Weekly Subject Activator Recordings
measure.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable was calculated for each weekly Patient Activator recording and for each subject. A random effects model was fitted to the data.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 30; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(19 patients who did not initiate recordings). Total analyzable recordings 58.

analysis.groups_desc: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable was calculated for each weekly Patient Activator recording and for each subject as follows: Duration (sec) of interpretable recording / Total duration of recording time (sec)

outcome.title: Interpretability of Automatically Triggered/Symptom Driven Recordings
outcome.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable for each automatically triggered/symptom driven recording and for each subject.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 47; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(2 patients whose recordings were lost due to programming changes). Total analyzable recordings 2804.

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients implanted with an SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Interpretability of Automatically Triggered/Symptom Driven Recordings
measure.description: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable for each automatically triggered/symptom driven recording and for each subject.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 47; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(2 patients whose recordings were lost due to programming changes). Total analyzable recordings 2804.

analysis.groups_desc: The proportion of recording time during which the device recording was interpretable for each automatically triggered/symptom driven recording and for each subject was calculated as follows: Duration of interpretable recording / Total duration of recording time

outcome.title: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings – Phase I
outcome.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a generalized estimating equation (GEE) model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.
outcome.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 47; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(2 patients whose recordings were lost due to programming changes).

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients implanted with an SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings – Phase I
measure.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a generalized estimating equation (GEE) model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.
measure.population: 50 patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in Phase I. Total patients 47; 50-(1 withdrawal)-(2 patients whose recordings were lost due to programming changes).

outcome.title: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings – Phase II
outcome.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a GEE model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.
outcome.population: All patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in participating in Phase II. Total patients 36: (19 rollovers from Phase I enrollments)+(25 Phase II enrollments)-(1 withdrawal)-(7 subjects with no automatically triggered recordings). Total recordings obtained: 958

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device.

measure.title: Inappropriateness of Automatically Triggered Recordings – Phase II
measure.description: The proportion of automatically triggered recordings that were inappropriate (i.e. noise triggered)was calculated and reported using a GEE model for binomial outcomes to account for multiple recordings per patient.
measure.population: All patients implanted with the SJM Confirm device in participating in Phase II. Total patients 36: (19 rollovers from Phase I enrollments)+(25 Phase II enrollments)-(1 withdrawal)-(7 subjects with no automatically triggered recordings). Total recordings obtained: 958

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline, 6-Week, 3-Month, and every 6 Months for the duration of the study or up to 5 years.
reported_events.desc: Patients were assessed for adverse events, and the Confirm device was evaluated at each study visit.

group.title: SJM Confirm Device
group.description: All patients in this study received the SJM Confirm device.

event.sub_title: Excessive Noise on the EGM Resulting in Inability to Interpret the EGM

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
